intro: Gymnanthes guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan gymnanthes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny fruit capsules that contain a single, large seed. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually clustered in inflorescences, and the plant is adapted to a variety of soil types in its native habitat.
